t: Proverbs 8
The Commendation of Wisdom
Does*pn not wisdom call, And*ln understanding lift up her voice?
On*ln top of the heights beside the way, Where*ln the paths meet, she takes her stand;
Beside*ln the gates, at the opening to the city, At*ln the entrance of the doors, she cries out:
“To*ln you, O men, I call, And*ln my voice is to the sons of men.
O*ln naive ones, understand prudence; And,*ln O fools, understand wisdom.
Listen,*ln for I will speak noble things; And*ln the opening of my lips will*i reveal*i right things.
For*ln my mouth will utter truth; And*ln wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
All*ln the utterances of my mouth are in righteousness; There*ln is nothing crooked or perverted in them.
They*ln are all straightforward to him who understands, And*ln right to those who find knowledge.
Take*ln my instruction and not silver, And*ln knowledge rather than choicest gold.
For*ln wisdom is better than jewels; And*ln all desirable things cannot compare with her.
“I,*ln wisdom, dwell with prudence, And*ln I find knowledge and*i discretion.
The*ln fear of the Lord*s is to hate evil; Pride*ln and arrogance and the evil way And*ln the perverted mouth, I hate.
Counsel*ln is mine and sound wisdom; I*ln am understanding, power is mine.
By*ln me kings reign, And*ln rulers decree justice.
By*ln me princes rule, and nobles, All*ln who judge rightly.
I*ln love those who love me; And*ln those who diligently seek me will find me.
Riches*ln and honor are with me, Enduring*ln wealth and righteousness.
My*ln fruit is better than gold, even pure gold, And*ln my yield better*i than choicest silver.
I*ln walk in the way of righteousness, In*ln the midst of the paths of justice,
To*ln endow those who love me with wealth, That*ln I may fill their treasuries.
“The*ln Lord*s possessed me at the beginning of His way, Before*ln His works of old.
From*ln everlasting I was established, From*ln the beginning, from the earliest times of the earth.
When*ln there were no depths I was brought forth, When*ln there were no springs abounding with water.
Before*ln the mountains were settled, Before*ln the hills I was brought forth;
While*ln He had not yet made the earth and the fields, Nor*ln the first dust of the world.
When*ln He established the heavens, I was there, When*ln He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,
When*ln He made firm the skies above, When*ln the springs of the deep became fixed,
When*ln He set for the sea its boundary So*ln that the water would not transgress His command, When*ln He marked out the foundations of the earth;
Then*ln I was beside Him, as*i a master workman; And*ln I was daily His*i delight, Rejoicing*ln always before Him,
Rejoicing*ln in the world, His earth, And*ln having*i my delight in the sons of men.
“Now*ln therefore, O*i sons, listen to me, For*ln blessed are they who keep my ways.
Heed*ln instruction and be wise, And*ln do not neglect it.*i
Blessed*ln is the man who listens to me, Watching*ln daily at my gates, Waiting*ln at my doorposts.
For*ln he who finds me finds life And*ln obtains favor from the Lord.*s
But*ln he who sins against me injures himself; All*ln those who hate me love death.”
